en-US.ami.externalParticipation.column.tip.ung: The world's largest corporate sustainability initiative.Members commit to implement the 10 principles of the UN  Global Compact, based on universal principles on human rights, labour, environment and anti-corruption, and report on their progress annually.
en-US.ami.externalParticipation.column.tip.ucn: Global Compact  Network China is the only local network of UN Global Compact in China upon authorized by the UN Global Compact  on annual basis.
en-US.ami.externalParticipation.relation.wbcsd: World Business Council for Sustainable Development
en-US.ami.externalParticipation.column.tip.wbc: WBCSD is an international organization closely associated with the United Nations. It was formed in 1995 by the merger of two international organizations dedicated to sustainable development and environmental protection, the Business Council for Sustainable Development and the World Industry Council for Environment. A global alliance, led by ceos from around the world, is working together to accelerate progress towards the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)
en-US.ami.externalParticipation.column.tip.une: United Nations Environment Programme Finance Initiative (UNEP FI) is a partnership between UNEP and the global financial sector to mobilize private sector finance for sustainable development. Major participants include banks, insurance companies and investment institutions
en-US.ami.externalParticipation.relation.unpri: United Nations Principles for Responsible Investment
en-US.ami.externalParticipation.column.tip.unp: UNPRI works to help investors understand the investment implications of environmental, social and governance (ESG) factors, and to support its international network of investor signatories in incorporating these factors into their investment and ownership decisions. Joining UN PRI means following the six Principles for Responsible Investment, including incorporating ESG issues into investment analysis and decision-making processes., and appropriate disclosure of ESG issues.
en-US.ami.externalParticipation.column.tip.eps: The Equator principle requires financial institutions, when investing in a project, to carry out a comprehensive assessment of the possible environmental and social impacts of the project, and to use financial leverage to promote the project to play a positive role in environmental protection and the harmonious development of the surrounding society.
en-US.ami.externalParticipation.column.tip.cdp: CDP is a none-profit organization that runs the global disclosure system for companies, cities to manage their environmental impacts. CDP is committed to persuade companies and governments to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and protect water and forest resources.

CDP is a not-for-profit charity that runs the global disclosure system for companies, cities to manage their environmental impacts. CDP is committed to persuade companies and governments to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and protect water and forest resources.
en-US.ami.externalParticipation.relation.tcfd: Task Force on Climate-related Financial Disclosures
en-US.ami.externalParticipation.column.tip.tcf: The Financial Stability Board established the Task Force on Climate-related Financial Disclosures (TCFD) in 2015 with a mandate to create guidelines for the global financial industry.The TCFD disclosure framework contains four areas - governance, strategy, risk management, and metrics & targets - that can help financial institutions assess how companies may be impacted in terms of revenues, costs and expenses, assets, and liabilities.
en-US.ami.externalParticipation.column.tip.sbt: The Science-Based Carbon Targets are based on climate science and aim to reduce carbon emissions and comply with the Paris Agreement's globally agreed targets for limiting global temperature rise.SBTi is a multi-agency partnership to support companies using different methods to set carbon targets and to validate the targets set by companies.
en-US.ami.externalParticipation.column.tip.re1: RE100 is the global corporate renewable energy initiative led by the Climate Group and in partnership with CDP, working to improve the friendly environment for using renewable electricity from the perspective of electricity demand.  To join the initiative, companies must make a public commitment to 100% renewable electricity between 2020 and 2050 and report their progress year by year.
en-US.ami.externalParticipation.column.tip.rsp:
As a non-profit organization, RSPO's membership covers stakeholders from seven sectors of the palm oil chain, including palm oil producers, processors and traders, consumer goods manufacturers, retailers, banks/investors, and environmental and social NGOs, working together to implement and promote global sustainable palm oil standards.
RSPO has developed a set of environmental and social standards that companies must adhere to in order to produce certified sustainable palm oil (CSPO). If applied properly, these standards can help palm oil producing regions minimize the negative environmental and community impacts of the palm oil growing process.
en-US.ami.externalParticipation.column.tip.rba: The RBA Code of Conduct establishes a set of norms for the electronics industry, or industries in which electronics is a major component, and its supply chain, to ensure a safe work environment, respectful and dignified workers, and environmentally friendly and ethical business operations.
en-US.ami.externalParticipation.column.tip.gma: Under the guidance of the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, China Green Manufacturing Alliance("The Alliance")is the national voluntary non-profit organization was jointly initiated and established by leading member units from the government, industry, university, research fund, and other parties. The purpose of the alliance is to actively respond to the national green manufacturing development strategy, to promote industrial green development, to gather high-quality resources such as "government, producing, education and research funds", to promote resource sharing and mutual benefit among alliance members, and finally to improve the level of green development of Chinese manufacturing.
en-US.ami.externalParticipation.column.tip.cgs: Supported by the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology("MIIT")，China Green Supply Chain Alliance("The Alliance") is the International Center for Economic and Technical Cooperation of MIIT initiated and established a national non-profit cooperative organization in conjunction with relevant enterprises, universities, research institutes, financial institutions and industry associations.The mission of the alliance is including conducting green supply chain management and technological innovation, green supply chain standardization research, providing green supply chain evaluation and services, promoting international information communication and cooperation, developing green supply chain investment and financing models etc.

en-US.ami.alterData.greenFactory.title: Green Factory
en-US.ami.alterData.greenFactory.requirement1: The factory shall be established in accordance with the law, and shall be complied with relevant laws, regulations, policies and standards during the construction and production process.
en-US.ami.alterData.greenFactory.requirement2: There have been no major safety, environmental protection, quality and other accidents in the past three years, and companies established less than three years ago have had no major safety, environmental protection, and quality accidents since their establishment.
en-US.ami.alterData.greenFactory.requirement3: Where a commitment is made to the environmental requirements of stakeholders, the relevant commitment requirements shall be met at the same time.
en-US.ami.alterData.greenFactory.requirement4: The top management shall assign responsibilities and authorities related to the green factory, ensure the acquisition of relevant resources, and promise and ensure that the requirements of the green factory evaluation are met.
en-US.ami.alterData.greenFactory.requirement5: The factory should have a green factory management organization responsible for the establishment, implementation, assessment and rewards of the green manufacturing system, and establish a target responsibility system.
en-US.ami.alterData.greenFactory.requirement6: The factory should have a mid- and long-term plan for green factory construction and quantitative annual goals and implementation plans.
en-US.ami.alterData.greenFactory.requirement7: The factory regularly provides green factory-related education and training, and evaluates the results of education and training.

en-US.ami.alterData.WaterPressureRisk.OptInfoC: Represents a world with stable economic development and carbon emissions peaking and declining by 2040, with emissions constrained to stabilize at ~650 ppm CO2 and temperatures to 1.1–2.6°C by 2100.
en-US.ami.alterData.WaterPressureRisk.UsualInf: Represents a world with stable economic development and steadily rising global carbon emissions, with CO2 concentrations reaching ~1370 ppm by 2100 and global mean temperatures increasing by 2.6–4.8°C relative to 1986–2005 levels.
en-US.ami.alterData.WaterPressureRisk.PessInfo: Represents a fragmented world with uneven economic development, higher population growth, lower GDP growth, and a lower rate of urbanization, all of which potentially affect water usage; and steadily rising global carbon emissions, with CO2 concentrations reaching ~1370 ppm by 2100 and global mean temperatures increasing by 2.6–4.8°C relative to 1986–2005 levels.
en-US.ami.alterData.WaterPressureRisk.waterPre: Water stress measures the ratio of total water withdrawals to available renewable surface and groundwater supplies. Water withdrawals include domestic, industrial, irrigation, and livestock consumptive and nonconsumptive uses. Available renewable water supplies include the impact of upstream consumptive water users and large dams on downstream water availability.

en-US.ami.companyInfo.remunerationPolicy.howWe:
A. Policy for Non-independent Directors and Senior Executives
  1. Remuneration elements: The company disclosed the components of the remuneration.
  2. Basis of decision-making: The company disclosed the factors affecting the decision making.
  3. Decision-making process: The company disclosed the process for setting remuneration.
  4. Incorporation of ESG factors: The company incorporated ESG factors into the remuneration policy.
  5. Detailed calculation methods: The company disclosed detailed calculation methods of the remuneration.
  6. Variable remuneration is capped: The variable remuneration is capped at a specific percentage.
  7. Clawback provision: The company included a clawback provision in its remuneration policy.
B. Policy for Independent Directors and Supervisory Board Members
  The company disclosed the remuneration policy for independent directors and supervisory board members.

en-US.ami.macroData.intro.no2: Refers to the concentration of NO2 column in the troposphere. The nitrogen oxide in the atmosphere mainly comes from thermal power plant emissions, automobile exhaust, etc.
en-US.ami.macroData.intro.o3: The ozone in the atmosphere mainly comes from vehicle exhaust, industrial emissions, etc.
en-US.ami.macroData.intro.co: The carbon monoxide in the atmosphere mainly comes from incomplete combustion of fossil fuels such as fuel oil.
en-US.ami.macroData.intro.ch4: Methane is one of the observable greenhouse gases (GHG).
en-US.ami.macroData.intro.aodm: AOD indicates atmospheric turbidity and is related to particulate pollutants (PM) : the higher the AOD value, the higher the concentration of particulate pollutants in the atmosphere.
en-US.ami.macroData.intro.aody: AOD indicates atmospheric turbidity and is related to particulate pollutants (PM) : the higher the AOD value, the higher the concentration of particulate pollutants in the atmosphere.
en-US.ami.macroData.intro.ndvi: If NDVI is equal to 0, it means the land is covered with rock or bare soil. If NDVI is greater than 0, it means there is vegetation coverage. The higher the value, the larger the covered area.

en-US.ami.macro.industry.summary.AUTOMOBILE.pa: Car Production and Sales Fell Significantly in April
New Energy Vehicles: Still Maintaining High Growth

In April 2022, the national automobile production and sales volume reached 1.205 million and 1.181 million respectively, down 46.2% and 47.1% YOY,and down 46.1% and 47.6% YOY, respectively. The epidemic has affected companies in many places to suspend production and production, and automobile production and sales fell significantly in April. From January to April, automobile production and sales were 7.690 million and 7.691 million, down 10.5% and 12.1% YOY, respectively.

en-US.ami.macro.industry.summary.ELECTRIC.para: The Growth Rate of Electricity Use in October was 6.1%. The Growth Rate of Electricity Use in Industries that Use a lot of Electricity Dropped Significantly.
Power generation by power source: Hydropower sinks, thermal power limited, nuclear and wind made up for the shortage

From January to October, the country’s electricity consumption was 6,825.4 billion kWh, a year-on-year increase of 12.2%. Among them, the country’s electricity consumption in October was 660.3 billion kWh, a year-on-year increase of 6.1%. In terms of industries, from January to October, the power consumption of the primary industry was 84.1 billion kWh, an increase of 18.4%; the power consumption of the secondary industry was 4,549 billion kWh, a year-on-year increase of 11.3%; the power consumption of the tertiary industry was 1194.9 billion kWh The electricity consumption of urban and rural residents was 997.4 billion kwh, a year-on-year increase of 7.4%. In terms of high energy-consuming industries, the cumulative electricity consumption from January to October still saw considerable growth, but the growth rate generally fell from the same period of the previous year. The monthly electricity consumption growth rate of the building materials and ferrous metal smelting industries fell sharply.

From January to October, the power generated by power plants of a certain size across the country rose by 10.0% year-over-year, and the growth rate was 8.6% higher than in the same period last year. The amount of thermal power produced by power plants of the right size across the country rose by 11.3 % year-over-year, and the growth rate was 11.7 % higher than last year. The hydropower generation of power plants above a certain size was 1022.2 billion kilowatt-hours, down 2.3% .From last year, and the growth rate was 6.5% lower than last year. A year ago, the country's nuclear power generation capacity was 336.6 billion kilowatt-hours, an increase of 12.7 %. This year, the growth rate was 7.0 % higher than last year at this time. Grid-connected wind power plants across the country made 526.8 billion kWh of electricity last year, which is up 40.9 % from last year. The growth rate was 25.9 % than last year.

en-US.ami.macro.industry.summary.STEEL.paragra: Steel Supply and Demand throughout the Year are High and Low
Net Exports Continued to Strengthen throughout the Year

Since October, the rise in coal supply guarantees and the slow demand for real estate and infrastructure investment have led to a drop in demand. Steel prices have dropped a lot because of the costs. Looking at the whole year, the demand side has weakened from strength to strength, and the disturbance on the supply side has been thrown on top of the big changes in commodity prices in the steel industry chain. This has led to big changes in the profitability of steel businesses. From January to October, the total amount of domestic crude steel made was 877 million tonnes, down 0.7% from the same time last year. The total amount of steel made was 1.122 billion tonnes, up 2.8% from the same time last year. It started to go down in July, and it's going down even more in October. Steel consumption in the United States from January to October was 1.036 billion tonnes, down 0.7% from last year. Steel consumption is ahead of crude steel, and the supply of steel has been going down since June.

Europe and the United States are going to pay a lot more for hot-rolled and cold-rolled steel than they do for domestic steel, especially at the plate end. This is going to lead to a lot more steel being exported from these countries because of this big price difference, especially at the plate end. From January to October, China exported 57.518 million tonnes of steel, down 29.49 % from last year. China imported 11.84 million tonnes of steel, down 30.36 % from last year; the total amount of steel exported was 45.684 million tonnes, up 66.58 % from last year. Net exports kept going up because of the big difference in steel prices. During the first nine months of the year, the total amount of steel billet that was imported was 9,365,400 tonnes, down 33.89 % from the same time last year. Steel billet was exported 3,900 tonnes.

en-US.ami.macro.industry.summary.METAL.paragra: Supported by Macro Benefits, Non-ferrous Metal Prices Rebounded

In December, the Central Economic Working Conference set the policy guidelines for the stable growth next year, including infrastructure investment advancement, loose in real estate policies, and carbon peaking and carbon neutralization to prevent a one-size-fits-all power cut and production limit, which benefits the recovery of industrial metal demand. On December 6 the Central Bank's comprehensive RRR cut by 0.5 percentage also supports the price of non-ferrous metals in terms of liquidity. Overseas, the European energy crisis has emerged, and some European zinc and aluminum smelters have been forced to reduce production, which has also benefited industrial metal prices in suppliments. In terms of precious metals, although FOMC determined that the Taper process will be accelerated and there may be three interest rate hikes in 2022, the Fed Chairman Powell also released a message indicating that the Fed's rate hike process will depend on the economic situation, which is good for precious metal prices that were previously suppressed. Specifically, in December, SHFE copper prices rose 0.76%, aluminum prices rose 7.29%, zinc prices rose 5.28%, lead prices fell 0.75%, nickel prices rose 2.45%, and tin prices rose 3.07%. To nobel metals, SHFE gold prices in December rose 1.36%, silver prices rose 1.41%.

The domestic economic momentum continued to lift. The year-on-year growth rate of industrial added value in November reached 3.80%. In December, the PMI index rebounded to 50.30, which has returned to the threshold for two consecutive months. The Central Economic Working Conference set the policy guidelines for the stable growth next year, including infrastructure investment advancement, loose in real estate policies, and carbon peaking and carbon neutralization to prevent a one-size-fits-all power cut and production limit, which benefits the recovery of industrial metal demand. On December 6 the Central Bank's comprehensive RRR cut by 0.5 percentage also supports the price of non-ferrous metals in terms of liquidity. Although In December, the Fed’s interest rate meeting determined that the Taper process will accelerate and there may be three interest rate hikes in 2022, but Fed Chairman Powell also stated that the Fed’s interest rate hike process will carefully consider the economic situation, and also released a dovish message under hawkish expectations, which increased the market risk appetite. Under the support of various benefits, the prosperity of the non-ferrous metal industry has rebounded.

en-US.ami.macro.industry.summary.AIR.paragraph: The Recovery in Demand has Clearly Faltered

The civil aviation industry handled 22 million passenger trips in November, down 51.5 percent year-on-year and less than 50 percent of the same period in 2019. Since August, the recurrence of the epidemic at local levels in China has led to an inferior recovery of the demand for civil aviation passenger transport in China. The monthly passenger transport volume of civil aviation has dropped twice to less than 25 million, which is far behind the pre-epidemic figure of 50-55 million. From January to November, the passenger transport volume of the industry has reached 413 million, only 68% of that of the same period in 2019. It is lower than the expectation of 80% between the industry recovery at the beginning of the year and the epidemic period, and the overall recovery pace is slowing down.

In the second half of this year, the growth rate of air cargo slowed down significantly due to factors such as reduced demand for epidemic prevention materials and limited supply of all-cargo aircraft, with year-on-year declines for four consecutive months from August to November, and the total annual cargo volume is expected to be the same as that of 2019.

en-US.ami.macro.industry.summary.OIL.paragraph: Oil Prices Rebound This Week as EIA Inventories Continue to Fall
OPEC Oil Output Reached 27.717 Million Bpd in November, Increased 285,000 Bpd MoM

This week, the milder symptoms of the Omicron variant have weakened market concerns about its impact. U.S. crude oil and refined oil inventories declined, oil demand recovered, and international oil prices rebounded. Brent and WTI crude futures settled at $77.78 and $75.21 per barrel respectively due on Dec. 31. The US dollar index traded around 96.0.

OPEC oil output increased in November. Saudi Arabia's oil production was 9.867 million barrels per day, increased by 101,000 barrels per day month-on-month; Iraq was 4.240 million barrels per day, increased by 91,000 barrels per day; Iran was 2.474 million barrels per day, decreased 9,000 barrels per day; Venezuela was 625,000 barrels per day,  increased by 15,000 barrels per day; Libya was 1.14 million barrels per day,  decreased by 15,000 barrels per day.

en-US.ami.macro.industry.summary.GLASS.paragra: Market Demand Stabilizes at the End of the Year

From January to November, flat glass output reached 930 million weight cases, an increase of 8.4% year-on-year, and the growth rate was 0.5 percentage points lower than that from January to October. The monthly output in November was 83.59 million weight cases, a year-on-year decrease of 0.5% and a month-on-month decrease of 2.2%.

From January to November, the floor spaces completed increased by 16.20% year-on-year, decreased 0.1 percentage points from January to October, and the decline was significantly narrowed. The completion end at the end of the year is in the rush, and the market demand for glass remains stable. Due on December 14, the price of float glass was 2,232.43 ¥/ton, increased by 3.47% year-on-year and 2.17% month-on-month. The glass price stabilized and rebounded, coupled with the recent decline in the cost-side soda ash and fuel prices, the profit of the float glass industry has been grown steadily.

en-US.ami.macro.industry.summary.COAL.paragrap: Coal Production Rose 4.6 Percent YoY in Nov, and 4.2 Percent YoY in the Cumulative Period
Production in Major Producing Areas Continued to Release in November

In November, China produced 371 million tons of coal, up 4.6 percent YoY and 3.85 percent from October. China's cumulative coal output from January to November was 3.674 billion tons, up 4.2 percent YoY and 0.2 percentage points higher than the previous month.

Monthly coal output in Shanxi, Inner Mongolia and Shaanxi in November was 106.3870 million tons, 99.2830 million tons and 59.2480 million tons respectively, up 11.05%, 7.07% and -3.52% YoY, and up 0.19%, 9.21% and 3.03% month-on-month, respectively. Shanxi, Shaanxi and Inner Mongolia accounted for 72.58 percent of the country's coal output in October, up 1.55 percentage points from the previous month.From January to November, the accumulative coal output of Shanxi, Mongolia and Shaanxi was 1.058 billion tons, 910 million tons and 618 million tons respectively, with YoY changes of 12.05 percent, 2.05% and 2.97 percent, respectively.

en-US.ami.macro.industry.summary.AFFAIRS.parag: The Growth Rate of Total Water Supply Declined Slowly
China's per Capita Water Consumption Continues to Decline

China's total water supply peaked in 2013, and since then, growth has slowly slowed as the central government and provinces have introduced strict water management systems. China's total water supply in 2020 was 581.29 billion cubic meters, accounting for 18.4 percent of the total water resources in that year. Surface water supplies 479.23 billion cubic meters of water, accounting for 82.4% of the total. Underground water sources supplied 89.25 billion cubic meters, accounting for 15.4% of the total water supply. Other sources supplied 12.81 billion cubic meters of water, accounting for 2.2% of the total water supply.

China's per capita water consumption continues to decline, from 445.09 cubic meters per person in 2015 to 411.74 cubic meters in 2020, due to the advocacy of water-saving society. Water consumption per ten thousand yuan of GDP (annual price) is 57.2 cubic meters. The actual irrigation water consumption per mu of cultivated land is 356 cubic meters, the effective utilization coefficient of farmland irrigation water is 0.565, the water consumption per 10,000 yuan of industrial added value (annual price) is 32.9 cubic meters, the urban per capita living water consumption (including public water consumption) is 207L/d, and the rural per capita living water consumption is 100L/d. Compared with 2015, water consumption per 10,000 yuan of GDP and added value per 10,000 yuan of industry decreased by 28.0 percent and 39.6 percent respectively (calculated at comparable prices).

en-US.ami.macro.industry.summary.CEMENT.paragr: Demand Side: Overall Sluggish, Down Sharply YOY
Cement Prices: the High Level of Oscillation Back Down to Adjust the Trend

In the first quarter of 2022, affected by the multi-point spread of the epidemic and the lack of funds for engineering projects represented by real estate, low project start-up rate, strict control of the epidemic and poor road transport, the cement market as a whole was sluggish and weak. National investment in fixed assets (excluding farmers) 10487.2 billion yuan, up 9.3% year-on-year. The same period of the previous year was an increase of 25.6%. Real estate indicators closely related to cement demand continued to decline, with national real estate development investment of 277.65 billion yuan, up 0.7% year-on-year; the area of new real estate construction fell 17.5% year-on-year. Another related indicator, infrastructure investment, improved slightly in the ring, up 8.5% year-on-year. 387 million tons of cement were produced nationwide in the first quarter of 2022, down 12.1% year-on-year. Among them, in March, the traditional peak season, the national cement production in a single month was only 187 million tons, down 5.6% year-on-year. From the monitoring data of China Cement Association, as cement inventory went high at the end of the first quarter, reflecting a greater drop in actual cement sales than production.

In the first quarter of 2022, the national cement prices showed a "high level of shock adjustment" characteristics. Since the beginning of the year, the national cement prices continue the trend of high fall in the fourth quarter of last year, supported by a significant increase in costs, the price decline significantly narrowed, different regions up and down, shock adjustment is dominant. From the regional monthly price trend, the first quarter in North China, Northeast and Northwest China belong to the off-season demand, most in the peak kiln shutdown period, production and sales are weak, the price and year-on-year high, but the overall in the price of no market. East China, South Central region slightly increased year-on-year, but the rate of increase is lower than the rate of cost increases, gross profit is lower than the level of the same period last year. Southwest region, although prices rose significantly year-on-year, but the price level is the lowest, only 431 yuan.

en-US.ami.macro.industry.summary.CHEMICAL.para: Manufacturing Prices of Chemical Raw Materials and Products Increase by 19.1% in 2021
Three Ministries and Commissions Issued Notice: Part of HFCs Chemical Projects be Strictly Controlled

In December 2021, the National Producer Price for Industrial Products increased by 10.3% year-on-year and decreased by 1.2% month-on-month; the purchasing price of industrial producers increased by 14.2% year-on-year and decreased by 1.3% month-on-month. Among them, manufacturing prices of chemical raw materials and products increased by 23.8% year-on-year and decreased by 2.1% month-on-month.

In order to implement the Kigali Amendment to the Montreal Protocol on Substances That Deplete the Ozone Layer effectively, the Ministry of Ecology and Environment, the National Development and Reform Commission, and the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology recently issued notice on strict control of part of HFCs chemical projects, and a strengthened environmental management for related construction projects, according to relevant provisions of the Regulations on Substances That Deplete the Ozone Layer. The 5 categories of HFCs to be controlled in the "Notice" include difluoromethane (HFC-32), 1,1,1,2-tetrafluoroethane (HFC134a), pentafluoroethane (HFC-125), 1,1 , 1-trifluoroethane (HFC-143a),and 1,1,1,3,3-pentafluoropropane (HFC-245fa).

en-US.ami.macro.industry.summary.PETROCHEMICAL: The cost-side is strongly supported, and the supply and demand relationship in the PX market is also supported. On the supply side, there was no significant change in market supply during the week. At the end of December, a set of 1 million tons/year PX units in South China entered into maintenance, and the overall market supply slightly declined. On the demand side, the demand for raw materials of PTA remained at a high level. A 4.5 million ton/year PTA equipment in Fujian province entered a 20-day overhaul in early January. Except for the equipment, other large equipments maintained normal operation. At present, the weekly average price of PX and CFR in China's main port is 913.61 (+29.40) US dollars / ton, the price difference between PX and crude oil is 329.94 (+20.42) US dollars / ton, and the weekly average price difference between PX and naphtha is 141.77 (+38.35) US dollars / tons, the operating rate is 70.20% (+0.50pct).

The cost-side is strongly supported, and the spot circulation of PTA is tight. On the supply side, a 1.1 million ton/year PTA unit in South China was restarted at the end of December, and a 700,000 ton/year PTA unit in East China was restarted in early January. A 4.5 million ton/year PTA unit in Fujian province was put into a 20-day overhaul in early January, and a set of 1.2 million tons/year PTA unit in East China was temporarily shut down from January 4th to 5th. On the demand side, the overall start of polyester production fell in a narrow range during the week. The terminal market is still dominated by stockpiling in advance, and some areas have stopped production and started holiday. At present, the weekly average spot price of PTA is 5052.86 (+203.57) yuan / ton, the industry average net profit is 55.86 (+31.59) yuan / ton, the operating rate is 70.80% (-2.30pct), and the PTA social circulation inventory is 226.50 (+ 8.90) tons.

en-US.ami.macro.industry.summary.INTERNET.para: The Number of Internet Addresses in Our Country has Risen Steadily
China's Internet Penetration Rate has Exceeded 70%

According to CNNIC data, as of June 2021, the number of IPv6 addresses in my country was 62023 yuan/32, an increase of 7.6%over December 2020. Among the 23 public recursive server manufacturers with high popularity within the scope of CNNIC monitoring, 12 have provided IPv6 public recursive services. The number of global IPv4 addresses has been distributed in February 2011, so since 2011, the total number of IPv4 addresses in China has basically remained unchanged. As of June 2021, the number of IPV4 addresses in my country was 393.19 million.

CNNIC's data from the "Statistics of the Development of China's Internet" over the years shows that the number of Internet users in my country and the Internet penetration rate of the Internet in 2011-2020 has risen steadily. As of June 2021, the scale of netizens in my country reached 1.011 billion, and the Internet penetration rate reached 71.6%. The current growth of netizens has entered a relatively stable stage, and the popularity of the Internet in the transforming population and residents of developed areas has reached a high level.

In November 2021, the Import and Export Volume of Pharmaceutical Materials and Pharmaceuticals in China was 19,900 Tons and 140,700 Tons, respectively

In November 2021, China's imports of pharmaceutical materials and drugs were 19,900 tons, an increase of 15.1% year-on-year, the import value was 4.174 billion US dollars, an increase of 20.6% year-on-year, and the number of China's pharmaceutical materials and pharmaceutical exports in November 2021 was 140,700 tons, an increase of 24.9% year-on-year, and the export amount was 3.956 billion US dollars, an increase of 78.6% year-on-year. From January to November 2021, China's imports of pharmaceutical materials and pharmaceuticals were 205,700 tons, with an import value of 40.574 billion US dollars, an export quantity of 1,291,500 tons, and an export amount of 44.39 billion US dollars.

The Production and Sales of Washing Machines Continued to Decline, and the Growth Rate of Domestic and Foreign Sales Declined

Industry online data show that in December 2021, the output of household air conditioners was 12.531 million units, a year-on-year -2.46%; sales volume was 11.5224 million units, -0.32% year-on-year, and the growth rate gradually narrowed, with inventory of 21.7111 million units, +12.51% year-on-year. Domestic sales of household air conditioners 5.7409 million units, -5.38% year-on-year; external sales of 5.7815 million units, +5.26% year-on-year, +25.61% month-on-month, in the same period, the inventory pressure of household air conditioners in December was larger, and the export performance was better than domestic sales.

Industry online data shows that in December 2021, the output of washing machines was 6.482 million units, -7.16% year-on-year, and sales volume was 6.5462 million units, a year-on-year -5.81%. Domestic sales of 4.182 million units, -5.36% year-on-year, export sales of 2.6808 million units, -8.6% year-on-year. The export sales of washing machines have declined significantly in the case of a higher base in the same period last year, and in the case of rising raw material prices and sluggish demand, they are more optimistic about the leading enterprises with bargaining power in the upstream and pricing power in the downstream.

en-US.ami.macro.industry.summary.PARTS.paragra: The Auto Parts Market is Gradually Expanding
Imports and Exports of Auto Parts were Stable

With the rapid development of China's automotive industry, the increase in automobile ownership and the expansion of the auto parts market, China's auto parts industry has developed rapidly, and the growth rate is overall higher than that of China's vehicle industry. Data show that China's auto parts sales revenue from 3.46 trillion yuan in 2016 to 4.57 trillion yuan in 2020, the average annual compound growth rate is 7.2%, it is expected that In 2021 China's auto parts sales revenue reached 4.9 trillion yuan.

Due to the shortage of chips, global automobile production is declining, and the demand for parts and components that provide supporting services for automakers has decreased, but the demand for new energy vehicles and maintenance aftermarket is still strong. According to the data, from January to August 2021, China's auto parts imports reached 48.886 billion US dollars, an increase of 45.9% year-on-year; exports reached 25.888 billion US dollars, an increase of 30.2% year-on-year.

In Terms of Exports, the Cumulative Export Value of Textiles and Garments in January-December Increased by 8.34% Year-on-Year

In November 2021, the online sales of men's wear, women's wear, children's wear, sports shoes and apparel, and home textiles increased by -23.59%, -12.05%, -2.37%, 5.62%, and 12.82% respectively, and the sales volume of each category increased by -28.08%, -18.40%, -12.45%, -4.49%, -3.07% year-on-year, and the average sales price of each category increased by 6.25%, 7.79%, 11.52%, 11.49% year-on-year, respectively. 19.56%。 Under the background of consumption upgrading, the average sales price of various sub-industries has risen by different margins, among which the home textile industry has maintained double-digit growth this year.

In December 2021, the export value of textile and garment increased by 15.30% year-on-year, of which the export value of clothing increased by 14.50% year-on-year, and the export value of textiles increased by 16.21% year-on-year, mainly due to the good control of the domestic epidemic and the acceptance of some orders returning from Southeast Asia. On the whole, the cumulative export value of textiles and garments from January to December increased by 8.34% year-on-year, maintaining a steady growth in single digits.

South China has the Highest Production (23.58%)

According to the National Bureau of Statistics, China's soft drink production in November 2021 was 11.7 million tons, an increase of 13.31% year-on-year; the cumulative output of China's soft drinks from January to November 2021 was 169.297 million tons, an increase of 12.28% year-on-year; China's soft drink production fell to the lowest in 2018 and rose sharply the following year.

According to the data of the National Bureau of Statistics, China's soft drinks in each quarter of 2021 are mainly concentrated in South China, East China and Southwest China; the distribution of China's soft drink production regions from January to November 2021 is uneven, of which South China has the highest output, especially Guangdong Province contributed the most production; from January to November 2021, China's soft drink provinces are far ahead of the other top 9.

en-US.ami.macro.industry.summary.RETAILER.para: Commodity Retail Sales Grew Steadily, and Upgraded Consumption Grew Rapidly
Online Demand Continued to be Released, and the Growth Rate of Physical Retail Slowed Down

From January to November 2021, due to the impact of the epidemic's multi-point sporadic and extreme weather, the growth rate of market sales continued to decline, but the overall double-digit rapid growth was maintained, online consumer demand continued to be released, and the consumer market continued to recover. From January to November, the total retail sales of consumer goods 399554 billion yuan, an increase of 13.7% year-on-year, maintaining rapid growth; an increase of 8.2% over the same period in 2019, and the average growth rate of the two years was the same as that of January to October. Although the growth rate of the company in September and October has rebounded in the month of zero, the outbreak of the new crown pneumonia epidemic in many parts of the country in November has had a greater impact on residents' consumption, especially catering and other aggregate consumption, catering income has turned from growth to decline, and the overall sales growth rate of the market has slowed down, which is currently at a low level. From January to November, the retail sales of urban and rural consumer goods increased by 13.8% and 13.3% respectively year-on-year, and the consumption expenditure of urban residents grew faster than that of rural residents.

From January to November, the national online retail sales 118749 billion yuan, an increase of 15.4% year-on-year. Among them, the online retail sales of physical goods reached 9,805.6 billion yuan, an increase of 13.2% year-on-year, down 1.4pct from January to October, and the growth rate continued to decline under the high base effect, with an average growth rate of 14.4% in two years. Online retail sales of physical goods accounted for 24.5% of the total retail sales of consumer goods, a significant increase of 0.8pct from January to October. Among the online retail sales of physical goods, eating, wearing and using goods increased by 18.8%, 11.1% and 13.1% respectively. The "Double Eleven" shopping festival has significantly increased the number of trade-in transactions, and green and low-carbon consumption trends such as "substitution for abandonment" and "minimalist packaging" have gradually emerged.

January 2022, the average price of fresh milk reached 4.27 yuan / liter, a slight increase year-on-year, a slight decline from the previous month, and the rise in fresh milk prices is expected to continue to ease.

In January 2022, the average price of piglets, pigs and pork fell slightly back to 27.62 yuan / kg, 14.62 yuan / kg and 23.20 yuan / kg, with a year-on-year change of -72.16%, -59.07% and -54.38% respectively. In January 2022, the average pig food price ratio reached 5.36, down 58.74% year-on-year and 11.84% month-on-month. Fresh/chilled meat production as of December 2021 was 32.982 million tonnes, up 24.50% year-on-year.

en-US.ami.companyRatingsReport.glossaryItemDes: The overall ESG performance of the rated company is computed based on MioTech’s ESG Ratings methodology, which evaluates over 800 qualitative and quantitative ESG data points that measure a company’s ESG risk exposure as benchmarked against industry peers; depending on a company’s industry, key ESG factors are selected and weighted for calculation according to their materiality. Scores from 0 to 100 are finally assigned and companies are then rated on a corresponding D to AAA scale. MioTech’s ESG Ratings are updated on a quarterly basis.
en-US.ami.companyRatingsReport.glossaryItemTit: Environmental Pillar / Social Pillar / Governance Pillar
en-US.ami.companyRatingsReport.glossaryItemDes: There are three pillars in MioTech’s ESG Framework – Environmental, Social and Governance. Environmental pillar consists of 9 topics: Environmental Management, Pollutants, Wastes, Material Consumption, Water Resources, Energy Consumption, GHG Emissions, Climate Change and Biodiversity. Social pillar consists of 6 topics: Labor Management, Employee Engagement & Diversity, Occupational Health & Safety, Community Impact, Product Responsibility and Supply Chain Management. Governance pillar consists of 4 topics: Business Ethics, Risk Management, ESG Management and Corporate Governance.

Materiality indicates the importance of a topic or indicator to the rated company within its defined industry. Material topics and indicators are the topics and indicators the rated company has the highest risk exposure to, and to be managed and considered as a priority. The materiality assessment is mainly influenced by industries, geographical locations, regulatory requirements and company-specific issues. Topics and indicators that are not identified as material will be assigned a weight of 0%, which means they have no impact on final ratings.
Weight indicates the importance and level of contribution of pillars, topics and indicators in the rating calculation process.

Controversial events are the rated company’s ESG controversial events detected through AI scanning of news, social media, and government regulation platforms. The controversial event counts denote the total number of news mentions. The risk levels of controversial events are risk levels of event types. The risk level of the same event type will not be differentiated based on specific event details.

The Supply Chain Risks section displays ESG controversial events of suppliers and customers in the rated company’s entire value chain and shareholding structure, allowing a full picture of the company’s ESG risk exposure upstream and downstream. In the rating process, suppliers’ ESG performance is reflected in the Supply Chain Management topic under the Social pillar, while the customers’ ESG performance has no impact on the rating of the rated company.

MioTech uses its self-developed MioTech Industry Classification System when categorizing companies for ESG ratings. The taxonomy considers the sustainability impacts alongside the basic features of the businesses, where businesses with similar ESG impacts fall into the same category. MICS consists of 11 primary sectors and 62 secondary sectors.

en-US.ami.companyRatingsReport.introMioTech:
MioTech uses artificial intelligence to solve the sustainability, climate change, carbon emissions reduction, and social responsibility challenges faced by financial institutions, corporations, regulators and individuals. Its comprehensive coverage of ESG data helps financial institutions make the right decisions in green finance and responsible investments. Its software helps corporations manage ESG reporting, improve energy efficiency, track and reduce carbon emissions. Its app builds green-conscious communities and promotes low-carbon lifestyles among individuals.
MioTech has offices in Hong Kong, Shanghai, Beijing, and Singapore. Its world-renowned investors include ZhenFund, Horizons Ventures, TOM Group, Moody's, HSBC, Guotai Junan International, GIC, and J.P. Morgan Asset Management.
